title: Validation error - Group Keypoints doesn't return anything
body:
I'm encountering some issue with training a custom dataset.

When running validation during training, i'm not getting any results from the `evaluate` function, upon checking deeper, the function `group_keypoints` inside the `evaluate` function is the one that is not returning anything. What is the possible reason for this?

```
print("all_keypoints_by_type length: ", len(all_keypoints_by_type)) 
print("avg_pafs length ", len(avg_pafs)) 

pose_entries, all_keypoints = group_keypoints(all_keypoints_by_type, avg_pafs)
print("pose_entries length", len(pose_entries))

coco_keypoints, scores = convert_to_coco_format(pose_entries, all_keypoints)
print("coco_keypoints length: ", len(coco_keypoints))

---

for idx in range(len(coco_keypoints)):
            coco_result.append({
                'image_id': image_id,
                'category_id': 1,  # person
                'keypoints': coco_keypoints[idx],
                'score': scores[idx]
            })
print("coco result length: ", len(coco_result))
```

Output:
```
all_keypoints_by_type length:  18
avg_pafs length  907
pose entries length: 0
coco_keypoints length: 0
coco result length:  0
```

This ultimately causes an error in the training pipeline where no annotations can be found during validation:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 170, in <module>
    args.checkpoint_after, args.val_after)
  File "train.py", line 130, in train
    evaluate(val_labels, val_output_name, val_images_folder, net)
  File "/home/jupyter/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/val.py", line 167, in evaluate
    run_coco_eval(labels, output_name)
  File "/home/jupyter/lightweight-human-pose-estimation.pytorch/val.py", line 22, in run_coco_eval
    coco_dt = coco_gt.loadRes(dt_file_path)
  File "/opt/conda/envs/pytorch==1.2.0/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pycocotools/coco.py", line 318, in loadRes
    if 'caption' in anns[0]:
IndexError: list index out of range
```
